title: Meditation session UI polish: responsive sliders and unclipped timer shadow

requirements.text: On the active meditation timer screen (the view shown after the user clicks “Start Meditation”), reduce the rendered width of both range inputs (volume slider and time/seek slider) by ~10–20% on screens narrower than 390px so they do not overflow horizontally.

quotes: I think < than 390px is a solid choise for that

acceptanceCriteria: When viewport width is < 390px, the volume slider and seek/time slider fit within the screen bounds with no horizontal overflow/clipping.
When viewport width is >= 390px, slider widths remain visually unchanged from the current design.

requirements.text: On the active meditation timer screen, remove any `overflow: hidden` styling that clips the circular SVG timer’s fill/shadow (the drop-shadow visible as the timer fills), so the shadow can render fully and fade naturally (no hard cutoff).

quotes: I want you to remove that overflow hidden property if any, so the shadow has good ending transition
I'd prefer overflow hidden constraint to be removed

acceptanceCriteria: During timer progress/fill animation, the circular SVG timer’s shadow is not visibly clipped by a container boundary.
The active meditation page does not introduce unwanted page scrolling as a result of removing overflow clipping (no persistent horizontal scrollbar).

constraints: Frontend-only change; do not modify backend canister code or schemas.
Do not edit files under frontend immutablePaths (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: No redesign of the meditation flow, timer behavior, or audio logic beyond the requested styling adjustments.
Do not change the shadow style/strength unless necessary to prevent clipping after removing overflow hidden (preference is to remove overflow clipping rather than reduce shadow).
